title: Monster Hunter Wilds' next update detailed as Steam reviews continue Overwhelmingly Negative plunge
description: Monster Hunter Wilds is not having a particularly good time of it over on Steam; thanks to ongoing performance issues and a perceived lack of meaningful content updates, players numbers are routinely dipping below those of the now seven-year-old Monster Hunter World, and recent reviews have tipped the game into Overwhelmingly Negative territory. Amid all this, Capcom has now outlined Monster Hunter Wilds' next free Title Update, but whether it'll do enough to shift player sentiment remains to be seen. Read more
author: Matt Wales

title: Two Point Museum is going rogue (and barbarian, and wizard, and bard) in its fantasy inspired new DLC
description: Daft but brilliant curation sim Two Point Museum is grabbing its D20s and venturing into the world of medieval fantasy for its first paid DLC release, which promises magical exhibits (and ensuing curses for unsuspecting guests), RPG-inspired expeditions, and more this July. Read more
author: Matt Wales

title: Street Fighter 6 Reveals Sagat Release Date And Some Very Steamy Swimsuits
description: Year 3 of Street Fighter 6 is underway, and the next DLC character coming to the roster is Sagat, the boss of the original Street Fighter arcade game. During Capcom Showcase, the publisher announced that Sagat will make his return to the franchise on August 5. And that's not all that's coming.The Sagat Arrives Fighting Pass will drop on July 4, and it includes Sagat's wanderer avatar gear. Capcom also noted that this update will increase the amount of content in the fighting pass that can be used in Fighting Ground. Ryu and Ken's EX colors were mentioned by name, as well as new art and effects to use for the game's challenger customization feature.Perhaps the biggest surprise for Street Fighter 6 fans today was the glimpse at the Outfit 4 content, which is basically a lot of thirsty swimsuits for Cammy, Luke, Chun-Li, Manon, Jamie, Kimberly, and A.K.I. Capcom mentioned that other characters will also be getting their swimwear costumes as well.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: How To Reach The Inventor In Death Stranding 2
description: Are you curious about how to reach the Inventor in Death Stranding 2: On the Beach? This NPC is relaxing all by his lonesome on an island, far from the rest of civilization. Oh, and trying to get to him is no mean feat due to the environmental hazards along the way.How to reach the Inventor in Death Stranding 2 - Inventor unlock and rewards guideThe Inventor can be found in Australia. Just like other NPCs in the game, he heads his own base/settlement, though he also happens to be an optional unlock. You won't be heading to his location early on as part of the main story, but you could opt to connect his abode to the Chiral Network to earn rewards. Inventor location, hazards, and what to bringTo unlock the Death Stranding 2 Inventor NPC, you must first be aware of his location and the items that he needs. First off, the Inventor himself resides on an island near the Mine North of F1:It's due north of West Fort Knot.The mine is actually where you get to activate the Monorail for the first time as part of a mission.The island is surrounded entirely by tar. That means your vehicle and cargo will sink, as will Sam if you're not careful.Moreover, the Inventor won't automatically want to be connected to the Chiral Network. Instead, you have to bring lost cargo that belongs to him--i.e. the item tag should say "Inventor." These items can be found via the following methods:Like other lost cargo, you could find some left behind on the ground.You may check MULE Postboxes that might have this type of loot.You can take a look at the shared cargo screen in facilities. Some players may have left these wares inside. You can deliver these yourself to earn some extra likes. Option 1: Cross the tar seaIn any case, it's time to reach the Inventor in Death Stranding 2. The first method, which is actually the safest and quickest, involves crossing the tar sea. Now, you don't actually want to drive across the dark pool of gunk immediately, as that will cause your vehicle to sink.Instead, you must use the Odradek scanner to reveal safe sections in the area. These places have a yellow outline, which denotes that you can traverse them without sinking. Option 2: Zip across via the MonorailAnother method involves the use of the Monorail that you just unlocked, but this does require you to bring a bunch of materials such as chiral crystals, special alloys, and resins. Walk over to a Monorail junction/terminal and check how much of each resource is needed. You could donate all of them on your own or you could ask other players to help by requesting aid.Once the Monorail junctions have been fully repaired, you should see a prompt to traverse via zipline. You can just carry the Inventor's goods on your back or use a Floating Carrier. Then, once you're just above the Inventor's island, press the button to jump back down on the ground. Option 3: Build structures that help you get acrossThe third option you can use to reach the Death Stranding 2 Inventor requires the use of various contraptions. These can only be unlocked once you've progressed further into the campaign, specifically upon connecting the F2 South Distribution Facility. This nets you the PCC Level 2 item, which lets you build higher-tier structures.We recommend the Jump Ramp for this, as it allows you to leap high up into the air. This is best done while on foot or while driving the Tri-Cruiser--the Pickup Off-Roader is a bit too heavy. How to unlock the Inventor's rewardsOnce the island base is connected to the Chiral Network, you should continue increasing your reputation to earn more rewards from the Inventor. The best way of doing this is by doing delivery runs from West Fort Knot back to the Inventor's settlement--i.e. take delivery orders or grab shared cargo from other players.These are the goodies that you can unlock:Level 1 - Otter HeadLevel 2 - Stun BombLevel 3 - Remote Stun BombLevel 4 - Bola Stun GunLevel 5 - Inventor Hologram and Otter Hood backpack patchAs you can see, the Inventor's wares can really help you on your journey. The Otter Head, if equipped, improves your swimming capabilities in case you find yourself submerged in deep water. The other gear pieces, meanwhile, offer new ways to incapacitate your foes.That's everything you need to know about the Inventor in Death Stranding 2. If you'd like to learn about other mechanics in the game, we suggest heading over to our beginner's guide.Humanity yearns to be interconnected once more, and it's up to you to deliver the goods. If you need more help, then we've got you covered in our Death Stranding 2 guides hub.

title: The New Street Fighter Movie Has The Most Bizarre Cast
description: Fighting game adaptations are some of the campiest, most absurd films in the already generally pretty absurd game-to-movie oeuvre. Films like the Mortal Kombat series, Dead or Alive, and the 1994 Street Fighter all possess a kind of so-bad-they’re-good ridiculousness that has made them cult classic guilty pleasures.…Read more...

title: Select Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 865
description: This time of year, Tabs was always pretty stoked about showing off his summer bod, which as you know, was curvy, Rubenesque and voluptuous. With this being the official weekend of the summer solstice, this morning I asked Rosie if she had any big plans for summer, and she just stared at me blankly and meowed something under her breath that sounded like “science waits for no one.” I took that as a “no.” 😂 Marnie’s sure been enjoying these longer summer days. In fact, she insists on waking me up at the crack of dawn so that she can go running with me, and by running I mean sprinting circles around me as I shuffle along… I believe she thinks that I am her sheep. 🐑 Your friendly neighborhood beauty addict, Karen The post Select Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 865 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 883
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. Do you care about Labubus? Nah, I just don’t get the hype. 2. What’s your favorite summer dessert? Hmm, all of them? If pressed to pick one, then ice cream. 3. Do you have plans for the Fourth of July yet? Connor will be dancing with her dance team in the town parade, so that’s our main event during the day. We’ll probably do a barbeque at home after the parade. Where we live doesn’t allow fireworks, so we may or may not go looking for a fireworks display. We’ll see how ambitious we’re feeling! 4. How do you feel about maxi dresses? If it’s in a petite size and the print isn’t too overwhelming, then I’ll rock a maxi dress, for sure. 5. What is the[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 883 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: The core concept behind Resident Evil: Requiem is "addictive fear", which isn't entirely as silly as it sounds
description: Right, how about a look at Resident Evil: Requiem then 'ey? Capcom revealed their latest entry in the horror series earlier this month at Summer Game Fest (after a little bit of a prank), but didn't really show off any gameplay. It was more just a "hey, it's real, and also here's our protagonist Grace Ashcroft!" kind of reveal. Our own Edwin got to take a look at it in action around the same time, but a new trailer during today's Capcom Spotlight has offered up a bit of a look for the rest of us now too. Read more
author: Oisin Kuhnke

title: Monster Hunter Wilds second title update is adding in Lagiacrus from Monster Hunter 3 when it arrives next week

One little game that got a look-in was, of course, Monster Hunter Wilds. Specifically, the second title update was shown off, which as always is adding a whole bunch of things in, so let's jump in.
